str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From ek and haireomai; actively, to tear out; middle voice, to select; figuratively, to release.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and phero; to bear together, i.e. to collect, or to conduce; especially advantage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A bodily organ, limb, member. Of uncertain affinity; a limb or part of the body.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; valley of Hinnom; ge-henna, a valley of Jerusalem, used as a name for the place of everlasting punishment.
